author: rubys
msg: Ensure that ns:SOAP-ENC is added only once per element

author: gdaniels
msg: 1) How did those 2-space indents get in there anyway?
2) Translate the faultcode to a string before the startElement() call,
so the namespace decl, if necessary, happens correctly
3) Clear the top of the namespace stack each time we pop in

author: gdaniels
msg: - Keep the prefixes associated with deserialized elements around
- Switch NSStack to use an ArrayList underlying representation.  This
means we have to do a linear search to find things, but typically
there aren't going to be more than a few mappings per element, so
we don't lose much.  More importantly, this also fixes a bug where we
couldn't deal with multiple prefixes mapping to a singe URI.

author: gdaniels
msg: Use callbacks when building faults to handle potential ID/HREFs
Don't default to dynamically using the string deserializer - rather, just
record the events and if someone asks for a value of a typeless element,
hand them a string containing the serialized XML.

author: gdaniels
msg: Set response message type early on.
